document.docAuthor: Ai, Deqiang, Wang, Yinglun & Zhang, Yalin
document.docTitle: Armorseliza lignaria Ai & Wang & Zhang 2019, n. comb.
document.masterDocTitle: A new genus and two new species in the tribe Selizini (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Flatidae) with a checklist for the tribe from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus and two new species in the tribe Selizini (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Flatidae) with a checklist for the tribe from China

bibRefCitation.author: Walker, F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Walker, F. (1851) List of the specimens of Homopterous insects in the collection of the British Museum, Part II. British Museum Trustees, London, 376 pp.

Seliza lignaria ( Walker, 1851 )
, transferred by
Stål, 1862b: 489

Seliza dubitans
Walker, 1858: 101
, synonymized by
Stål, 1862b: 78

Poeciloptera punctifrons
Walker, 1858: 118
, synonymized by
Atkinson, 1886: 78

Seliza angulifrons
Jacobi, 1915: 176
, synonymized by
Medler, 1986: 107

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. The species differs from other members of this genus by the following characters: mesonotum ( Fig. 3 ) with 3 carinae, apical fourth of aedeagus ( Figs 7 , 12, 19 ) with a pair of cephalad and 3-branched processes, dorsal apical part of aedeagus without tooth.

Coloration. Overall color dark brown or black; head mottled brown, margins of frons slightly darker, two pairs of black spots—the first pair at the anterior margin of head, the second pair at the lateral margins of head, clypeus with oblique stripes; eyes black, ocelli red; pronotum and mesonotum dark brown or black; tegmina dark brown with darker veins, Y-stem of clavus black.

Material examined.
